definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: I'll give you a receipt when I'm through.
sentences.chinese: 完了我会给你一张收条。

sentences.english: I will write out a receipt for you .
Please give the receipt to the bearer.
B: We'll check it into the bonded storage room, and give you a receipt.
sentences.chinese: 我们将物品登记后放到关栈保管室，并给你一个收条。

sentences.english: Please mail the original bank pay-in-slip together with this form to us.
sentences.chinese: 请将存款收条正本连同此表格寄回本会。

sentences.english: Please give me a written recept for Customs.
sentences.chinese: 请给我一张收条以备报关之用好吗？

sentences.english: No problem. If you wait one moment, I’ll make you out our receipt.
sentences.chinese: 没有问题，请等一下，我给你开个收条。

sentences.english: They need not send me a receipt.
Here is your change and your receipt.
Here's your receipt. Now, please have it well wrapped and sealed.
sentences.chinese: 这是您的收条，现在，请您把它包起来，捆好。

sentences.english: I thought it was just a receipt.
sentences.chinese: 我借觉得这只是一张收条罢了。
